How can you engineer a better data-oriented REST conversation between an
automated REST client and an automated REST server?  On the HTML side of
REST, where there's a human involved, there are "experts" in the field of
"Information Architecture" who have the resposibility to construct "a big
picture" that assure that the various types of system users have appropriate
paths (and links) through the system that support each user profile's needs
within a system.
Has anyone used an "Information Architect" to develop a REST API?

-Solomon
